intro: Duguetia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian bellflower, is a woody shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically ovate and glossy, with a rough texture. Duguetia amazonica is often found in moist, shaded areas and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
